title: spooky's_house_of_jump_scares
body:
A horror game rife with references to other popular horror. In it, the player must navigate a mostly randomly-generated mansion made up of 1000 floors, with checkpoints placed throughout. On certain floors, the rooms have preset layouts, and the player will encounter a monster that proceeds to chase them for a few floors. These monsters may also appear later in the game at random to chase the player.

The game is notable for having a very cutesy appearance, which is arguably creepy in and of itself.
[spoiler]At least, until the first monster shows up, at which point the game takes a very dark turn into being actually terrifying. The ambiance, room designs, and monsters become increasingly horrifying as the game progresses.[/spoiler]

A DLC, Karamari Hospital, was released for the game after the full release. As the name implies, it takes place in a hospital.
[spoiler]Don't worry, it's just as terrifying as the original.[/spoiler]

title: memedorza
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZMT-S16G Memedorza[/b]

A [[Zanscare]] experimental aerial combat [[mobile suit]] that has a very long flight range. It is equipped with dual beam rotors in its shoulders that enable it to fly very fast.

title: zoloat
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZM-S06S Zoloat[/b]

A [[mobile suit]] designed for [[space]] combat and deployed by the [[Zanscare]] Empire in vast numbers. 

It possesses powerful thrusters and a large number of verniers, giving it greater mobility than most [[Earth Federation]] Forces mobile suits, though the Zoloat did suffer from a slower top speed due to its heavier weight. 

Nonetheless, it possessed an overall greater performance, and has higher power output which allows it to more efficiently use beam weapons. As a result, it is more than a match for the Earth Federation's mobile suits until the advent of the League Militaire's LM111E02 [[Gun-EZ]] mechas.

title: birknau
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZMT-A30S Birknau[/b]

A prototype [[mobile armor]] developed by [[zanscare|BESPA]] for [[battle]]field commanders. It is equipped with considerable search and information-collecting capabilities. 

It was developed with high performance in mind and possessed high mobility and firepower. The Birknau was designed to quickly arrive at the battlefield in anticipation of facing numerous enemy [[mobile suit]]s. To adapt to different combat situations, the Birknau is armed with several weapons including Mega Particle Cannons and Mega Machine Cannons for long-range attack and Claw Arms for close combat.

title: donkey
body:
A hoofed mammal of Equidae family that brays, domesticated for riding and as a working [[animal]]. Compared to [[horse]], donkeys tend to be smaller with less curved back profile. They have shorter mane and longer ears (often with darkened tips).

An alternate name for this animal is an ass, but Danbooru uses that term to refer to a person's [[ass|rear end]].

title: rig_shokew
body:
[b]ZM-S22S Rig Shokew[/b]

A mass-production version of the prototype ZMT-S12G [[Shokew]] [[Zanscare]] [[mobile suit]] with several improvements. The Rig Shokew has increased generator output, a new backpack, additional verniers for greater maneuverability, and a greater amount of more powerful thrusters for better speed and acceleration. 

A higher amount of titanium was incorporated in the alloy of its armor, giving it better durability. The Rig Shokew stands a meter taller, and the added size adds a bit to the empty weight, yet when fully-loaded it is lighter than the original Shokew.

title: shokew
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZMT-S12G Shokew[/b]

A prototype, general purpose test [[mobile suit]] developed for gathering data for the the next generation of the [[Zanscare]] Empire's mass production mecha. It was very versatile and easily to pilot. 

The forehead is equipped with a pair of V-shaped blade antennas, and both eyes are equipped with a multi-sensor. The Shokew obtained satisfactory test results, and its data was used to create a better mass production machine, the ZM-S22S [[Rig Shokew]].

title: victory_gundam_hexa
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]LM312V06 Victory Gundam Hexa[/b]

A variant of the [[V Gundam]] equipped with a new model of [[Core Fighter]] that features a modified [[mobile suit]] head for use by squadron leaders, its overall combat abilities are identical. 

Aside from the fact that the "rabbit ears" (long range [[space]] [[radio antenna]]) give the Hexa a distinctive appearance, the new head unit features a more advanced sensor and communication system. With the improved equipment, the [[pilot]] of the Hexa would have superior knowledge of [[battle]]field conditions and be more capable of piercing electronic countermeasures and maintain contact with comrades.

title: bruckeng
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Victory Gundam]] anime series from 1993.

[b]ZM-S21G Bruckeng[/b]

While the Zanscare ZM-S24G [[Gedlav]] was a formidable unit in conjunction with the [[Einerad]] support craft, the Einerad would occasionally be taken from it and used against it. 

The Bruckeng addresses that problem by equipping the new Segmented Einerad on to its back and deploying it when needed. The Segmented Einerad made the Bruckeng highly versatile as it could now be used for defense by unfolding around the Bruckengs waist and spin to deflect beam rifle fire, which also allowed it be used as a ramming weapon. Another new feature added was that the Einerad could also separate into four parts and be used to hold enemy mobile suits, allowing the Bruckeng to destroy them. 

The Bruckeng was equipped with the standard [[Zanscare]] weaponry of a beam shield and a pair of beam sabers, and for added firepower it could be equipped with a [[beam rifle]] and [[missile pod]]s on its shoulders.

title: drawstring
body:
A drawstring is a cord that, when pulled, gathers up and shortens the material through which it is threaded. Drawstrings are commonly used to secure hoods on [[hoodie|hoodies]] and [[hooded_jacket|hooded jackets]] and tighten waistbands on garments such as [[sweatpants]] and [[bloomers]]. They may also be used to to keep [[bag|bags]] closed.

title: remembrance_day
body: Originally Armistice Day, this is 11 November in the United Kingdom and the British Commonwealth. On this date, the end of [[World War I]] and the fallen soldiers of that conflict and others are commemorated and remembered. It is the tradition on that day to wear a red [[poppy_(flower)|poppy]] to commemorate the poppy fields that now grow over the battlefields of France and Belgium. France and Belgium also observe Remembrance Day, with the French using the blue cornflower (the bleuet de France) in place of the poppy. The United States also celebrates the same day as Veterans Day, honoring all military veterans. h4. See also * [[Tag Group:Holidays and Celebrations]] h4. External links * "Wikipedia: Armistice Day":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Armistice_Day] * "Wikipedia: Remembrance Day":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Remembrance_Day] * "Wikipedia: Veterans Day":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Veterans_Day]

title: clift
body:
A character in [[Dragon Quest IV]]. Along with [[Brey]], he is one of the companions of [[alena (dq4)|Alena]] and usually drawn in connection with her. 

His hat is a [[mitre]].

In the original NES localization, he was named [b]Cristo[/b] while in modern localizations (from the DS remake onward), he is named [b]Kiryl[/b] and he speaks with a thick Russian accent just like his companions whenever he has dialogue.

He is infamous in the original versions of the game for his AI, where he will always try to cast his instant kill spells first on bosses (who are likely to be immune in the first place) instead of doing his job of healing the party.

title: remington_msr
body:
The [b]Remington MSR[/b] is a [[bolt action]] modular [[sniper rifle]] designed and manufactured by [[Remington Arms]]. Introduced in 2009, it was designed for the United States Army and USSOCOM requirements, thus entered service in 2013.
To facilitate caliber change, the [[rifle|rifle's]] bolt is equipped with removable bolt heads, with bolt faces matched for appropriate calibers.

title: gottrlatan
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZMT-S33S Gottrlatan[/b]

An experimental [[mobile suit]] developed by BESPA ([[Zanscare]] Imperial Army) near the end of the Zanscare War in U.C. 0153. A high-performance, all-purpose unit which specialized in close-combat, it was equipped with a pair of hand-carried beam tonfas, as well as a large beam cutter blade mounted on its head. 

The unit was capable of docking with a mega beam cannon whose devastating firepower could wipe out several enemy mobile suits or ships with a well-aimed shot. For standard ranged combat, it was armed with a [[beam rifle]].

It was [[Katejina Loos]] mecha of choice.

title: gun-ez
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in the [[Victory Gundam]] anime series from 1993.

[b]LM111E02 Gun-EZ[/b] 

A mass production ground-use [[mobile_suit|MS]] that was developed from the [[V Gundam]]. The Gun-EZ was intended to serve as the workhorse of the League Militaire's mobile suit corps. While unspectacular, it possessed adequate performance, and could take the fight to the evil [[Zanscare]] Empire in their own terms.

The model was later modified into the [[space]] use [[Gun Blastor]] MS as the front lines moved out of planet Earth.

title: rig_contio
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZMT-S34S Rig Contio[/b]

A Zanscare Empire [[mobile suit]] based on and intended to replace the ZM-S14S [[Contio]]. In terms of power output and speed the Rig Contio has upgraded performance specs compared to the Contio. Its armaments are much the same with three exceptions. 

First, the Rig Contio's defensive abilities are upgraded possessing two beam shields, one on each back of the hand, where the Contio had only one on his left forearm. Second, the shot claw on the left shoulder is more powerful than Contio's shot claw and it's not wire-guided unlike its predecessor. Finally, the shot claw on the right shoulder has been replaced by a variable beam launcher with the power to destroy a battleship in a single shot.

title: zollidia
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series. It first appeared in [[Victory Gundam]] from 1993.

[b]ZM-S06GS Zollidia[/b]

One of several [[mobile suit]]s based on the ZM-S06S [[Zoloat]] used by the Zanscare Empire for [[space]] combat. Specifically, the Zollidia was designed as a ground-use version for combat on Earth and optimized as such. 

Changes include an increase in armor, a reduction of thrusters' numbers, and a slight increase to the reactor output. Because of the changes to the shoulders, the Zollidia lacks the Zoloat's beam string emitter and the beam shield is relocated to the left forearm. This placement of the beam shield allows the Zollidia to protect itself from any direction, making it much more effective than the Zoloat's beam shield.

title: tsuwabuki_(kunoichi_tsubaki_no_mune_no_uchi)

title: aks-74u
body:
The [b]shortened[/b] design of the Soviet [[AKS-74]], first adopted adopted in 1979. It has shorter barrel and gas piston rod, which cause increased rate of fire. The rear sight placement is integrated to the top dust cover, instead of being placed on a block. Due to the short barrel and conical muzzle device, the muzzle flash appears very prominent.

Sometimes in video games, the [[weapon]] is inaccurately depicted. For instance, in [i][[Call of Duty]][/i], it is portrayed having [[kalashnikov rifle|AKMS]]-styled bottom-[[folding stock]] instead of side-folding one, even mistakenly named "AK-74U".

h1. See also

title: warship_girls_r
body:
[b]Warship Girls R[/b] (战舰少女 [i]Zhan Jian Shao Nyu[/i]) is a shipgirl-themed Chinese smartphone game.

Gameplay is similar to [[Kantai Collection]]. However, unlike [[Kantai Collection]], where most of the ships originally came from the [[Imperial Japanese Navy]], Warship Girls R from the start featured ships from various Navy forces around the world. 

h4. History

The game was initially released by "Suzhou Paiqu Network Technology":[http://www.p7game.com/], as Warship Girls, for Android and iOS devices in September, 2014.

In July 2015 there was a split between the publisher of the game and its developer, MoeFantasy (幻萌), and from then on each company developed and released its own version of the game, which differed in available characters, interface design, etc.

On August 29th 2015 at ComiCon16, Shanghai, MoeFantasy revealed via trailer the development of [i]Project R[/i], a major overhaul of the game including new features, updated UI and a new animated combat system. This version was released in November the same year as client version 2.0 and was dubbed 战舰少女R (Warship Girls R). The MoeFantasy version would become the main focus of all community efforts, from wikis to drop data libraries and fan works.

On June 23rd 2016, it was announced on the community's Baidu forum and later as official statements that a settlement had been reached between the two companies. SPNT shut down its servers on September in the same year.

On October 24th 2017, a Japanese translated version and server released under the name 戦艦少女R, or Senkan Shoujo R.

On December 18th 2018, a Global server and Korean server were officially released.

Also in 2018, on September 8th, a spinoff was released that was made by MoeFantasy's Japanese branch, entitled 蒼青のミラージュ or [[steelblue mirage|MiST: The mirage of steelblue]]. Due to various reasons, it became unavailable on March 15th, 2020, with refunds beginning at the same time, ending on June 15th.

The Global server and Korean server were shut down on the 31st of August, 2021.

h4. See also

* [[Kantai Collection]]

title: gun_blastor
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Gundam]] series.

[b]LM111E03 Gunblaster[/b]

The Gunblaster (a.k.a. [b]Gun Blastor[/b]) is a mass-production [[mobile suit|MS]] that appeared in the [[Victory Gundam]] anime series from 1993. 

To meet the need for space-use mobile suits, the League Militaire modified their ground-use LM111E02 [[Gun-EZ]] into the space combat LM111E03 Gunblaster by adding a pair of "twin tail" thruster binders.

title: elephantfish
body: The Mormyridae, sometimes called "elephantfish", are a superfamily of weakly electric fish in the order Osteoglossiformes native to Africa. It is by far the largest family in the order, with around 200 species. Members of the family can be popular, if challenging, aquarium species.

title: porky_pig
body: Porky Pig is an animated character in the Warner Bros. [[Looney Tunes]] and Merrie Melodies cartoons. He was the first character created by the studio to draw audiences based on his star power, and the animators created many critically acclaimed shorts featuring the character. Even after he was supplanted by later characters, Porky continued to be popular with moviegoers and, more importantly, the Warners directors, who recast him in numerous everyman and sidekick roles.

title: daffy_duck
body: Daffy Duck is a [[Looney Tunes]] character created by Tex Avery (although Bob Clampett contributed to Daffy's personality) in 1937. He was the first of the new breed of "screwball" characters that emerged in the late 1930s to supplant traditional everyman characters, such as [[Mickey Mouse]] and [[Porky Pig]].

title: the_scorpion_(slam_masters)
body:
The final boss of the [[Saturday Night Slam Masters]] [[wrestling]] [[video game]] from [[Capcom]]. 

[b]El Escorpio[/b] or [b]El Escorpión[/b] ([b]The Scorpion[/b]) is a mysterious, very skilled and powerful masked [[mexico|Mexican]] [[luchador]]. He is a playable character in later games of the series.

The character's name in the original Japanese edition of the game was "The Astro" (アストロ, Asutoro). The design of The Scorpion is strongly based in [[real life]] luchador "Tinieblas":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinieblas ("Darkness") and his son, "Tinieblas JR.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tinieblas_Jr._ The original Tinieblas was one of the first luchadores to ever tour [[Japan]] back in the 1970s and became very popular there.

title: powered_suit_(toaru)
body:
A Powered Suits (駆動鎧 (パワードスーツ) Kudō Yoroi (Pawādo Sūtsu), lit. "Driven Armor") are a [[power suit]]s, [[power armor]], [[exoskeleton]]s and manned [[mecha]]s in [[Toaru majutsu no index|ToAru series]].

"The main goal of the suit is to reinforce a person's body and mind to greatly increase their combat ability, using things like motors and chemical springs. Powered suits normally just match the user's movements within the suit, though advanced suits can also correct the user's movements on their own. They can also carry specialized weapons and weapons that would be too heavy for a normal human to carry. Powered Suits have also been described as capable of moving 10 times faster than a normal vehicle.

Mass-produced powered suits are normally humanoid in appearance, as there are problems when a human tries to pilot a different shaped suit. To control a 4-legged powered suit, one has to become a 4-legged animal. To control an 8-legged powered suit, one has to become an 8-legged animal. Even if some of the controls are left to a program leaving simplified controls for the use, in the end, that's what is required to truly control a powered suit."

h1. List of Powered Suits
[[Anti-Art Attachment]]
[[Power Lifter (toaru)|]]
[[Equ.DarkMatter]]

title: mospeada_(mecha)
body:
[[Mecha]] featured in the 1980s anime TV show [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]]. 

[b]M.O.S.P.E.A.D.A.[/b] stands for "[b]M[/b]ilitary [b]O[/b]peration [b]S[/b]oldier [b]P[/b]rotection [b]E[/b]mergency [b]A[/b]viation [b]D[/b]ive [b]A[/b]rmor". This mecha is a transformable [[motorcycle]]-[[power armor]] hybrid used by the humans to fight the [[Inbit]] [[alien]]s that have invaded Earth.

There are three basic models shown in the series:

* The red [b]VR-038L Bartley[/b] is armed with a six-round [[rocket launcher]] and is the most agile but least armored of the [b]M.O.S.P.E.A.D.A.[/b] versions.
* The blue [b]VR-041H Blowsperior[/b] is equipped with a pair of [[arm_blade|retractable vibroblades]]/[[shield]]s for close combat and carries 12 mini-missiles in [[missile_pod|internal chest racks]].
* The green [b]VR-052 Battler[/b] comes in two sub-models carrying different weapons: the [b]VR-052F[/b], armed with a [[beam rifle]] and forearm [[rocket launcher]]s, and the [b]VR-052T[/b], which carries a high-capacity beam pistol.

This mecha was designed by [[Aramaki Shinji]]. When asked about the inspiration for his innovative variable motorcycle design, Aramaki replied that he thought his own motorcycle at the time (possibly a [[Suzuki Katana]], which greatly resembles the Mospeada) was just the right size for a man to wear as [[armor]], so he designed the Mospeada mecha from it.

title: garfish_(spacecraft)
body:
A fictional [[military]] [[spacecraft]] form the [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]Garfish[/b] is a type of human combat [[spacecraft]] designed for tactical [[space]] [[fleet]] operations. It functions as a small gunship or light attack cruiser and is equipped with six large [[missile]] launchers and a large three-barreled particle beam cannon [[turret]] under its main superstructure.

The Garfish is also used as a high speed space transport and it was used in more than one of the invasion fleets that attempted to recapture Earth from the [[Inbit]]. The lowest part of the ship has a three door launching bay that carries nine [[Legioss]] in armo-fighter mode. 

The Garfishes that took part in the first two Earth Reclamation Invasion Fleets were painted blue and white while the ships of the Third Invasion Fleet were painted red and dark gray.

title: sirin
body:
A [i][[Honkai Impact 3rd]][/i] and [i][[benghuai_xueyuan|Benghuai Xueyuan]][/i] character. The second Herrscher after [[Welt Joyce]], and dominated the power of the void. She became a Herrscher and started the Second Impact in 2000 at a Schicksal laboratory and has pulled the whole North Siberia into her void realm. Rumours say that she was inhumanely experimented on and tortured by the tests and therefore awakened the Herrscher consciousness inside of her and took the girl's mind.

Sirin perished together with S-rank Valkyrja [[Cecilia Schariac]] and four other A-rank Valkyries (Squad Snow Wolf) in a series of nuclear explosions caused by a rain of missiles from Schicksal.

After Sirin's death, her Herrscher core got been divided into five parts, those being the main Core of Void itself and the 4 extra Authorities granted to her, those being the Gem of Conquest (Thunder), Gem of Desire (Wind), Gem of Haste (Fire), and Gem of Serenity (Death). The four different Gems are kept separately by Schicksal and Anti-Entropy, while the Void Core was secretly obtained by Otto while everyone else was unaware of its existance.

In the current game era (Honkai Impact 3rd) [[Otto Apocalypse]] created [[kiana_kaslana|K-423]] (a clone of Kiana Kaslana mixed with Sirin's DNA) using the techniques he used for his adopted granddaughter [[Theresa Apocalypse]], and inserted the Void Core into the empty clone, succesfully giving it life and Sirin a new body.

Sirin's soul/consciousness within the core then split into two: the side that wanted a happy life as Cecilia's daughter (K-423 Kiana), and the side that wanted revenge on the world ([[kiana_kaslana_(herrscher_of_the_void)|Void Kiana]]).

Thus was Sirin the Herrscher of the Void resurrected/reincarnated, just as Otto secretly planned. The Void's power doesn't normally show up, but in some special conditions, her power would burst dealing a large scale of destruction. The mysterious sound in Kiana's (K-423) head is actually Void Kiana's, her other self, but she doesn't have a clue.

She is named after the Russian mythological creature of the same name which is usually depicted as a beautiful half-woman, half-bird.

In version 5.0, an ELF form of her was released. In version 6.9, [[sirin (miracle magical girl)|Miracle Magical Girl]], a Magical Girl version of Sirin from a bubble world, became playable as a Mecha/Fire battlesuit.

title: roman_numeral
body:
Refers to the ancient Roman way of writing numbers. Likely because of the elegant style, it is still usually recognized and understood by everyday people (at least from 1 to 10), as well as frequently used on clocks.

* 1 = I
* 2 = II
* 3 = III
* 4 = IV (one below 5)
* 5 = V
* 6 = VI (one above 5)
* 7 = VII (two above 5)
* 8 = VIII
* 9 = IX
* 10 = X (can be remembered by how 2 V's form an X; 5*2=10)
* 11 = XI
* 12 = XII

* 50 = L
* 100 = C
* 500 = D
* 1000 = M

h4. See also

* [[dial]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Roman numerals":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Roman_numerals

title: yellow_heart_(neptunia)
body:
A character from [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]].

Acts as an antagonist, but only because she isn't particularly intelligent, and is being manipulated by [[Anonedeath]] and [[Kiseijou Rei]], who she believes are her parents.

She has shoulder-length [[blonde hair]] worn in a [[high ponytail]] and [[orange eyes]] with white [[power symbol]]-[[symbol-shaped_pupils|shaped puils]]. She wears a [[white bodysuit]] with matching [[thigh boots]], [[elbow gloves]], and a [[choker]], all three decorated with traces of black, red, and yellow. She has a [[large_breasts|voluptuous figure]]. Her weapons are a pair of [[vambraces]] with three large yellow claws each.

Her personality is cheerful, energetic, and outgoing, but not particularly intelligent, treating battle like a game. She boasts the largest chest of the whole series at an I cup, causing [[breast envy]] in [[Vert (neptunia)|]] of all people.

She is also a [[personification]] of the [[PC Engine]], known as the TurboGrafx-16 in the West.

Voiced by: [[Yuuki Aoi]] (Japanese), Sandy Fox (English, games), Tia Ballard (English, anime)

* [[Pish]], her untransformed form

body: Challah is a special bread of Ashkenazi Jewish origin, usually braided and typically eaten on ceremonial occasions such as Shabbat and major Jewish holidays. title: help:bulk_update_requests
body:
A bulk update request (abbreviated BUR) is a request to change one or more tags. You can request that a tag be aliased, renamed, combined with another tag, deprecated (locked so it can't be added to posts), or make it so that adding one tag automatically adds another tag (an implication).

To make a bulk update request, go to "the forum":[/forum_topics] and click "Request alias/implication" at the top of the page, or open the "new request form":[/bulk_update_requests/new] directly. Making a bulk update request will create a new forum thread. You will need to enter a forum thread title, your request, and a reason for the request. You can look at other requests on the forum for examples of how to format your request.

There are 7 types of requests:

* Aliases
* Tag renames
* Implications
* Mass updates
* Tag deprecations
* Category changes
* Nukes

h4. Aliases

An alias is used to rename a tag, to combine two tags into one, or to add an alternate name for a tag. When a tag is aliased, anyone searching for the old tag will be redirected to the new tag. For example, aliasing [[tie]] to [[necktie]] would mean that anyone searching for [[tie]] would be redirected to [[necktie]].

To request an alias, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]create alias tie -> necktie[/code]

To request that an existing alias be removed, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]remove alias tie -> necktie[/code]

h4. Tag renames

A tag rename is used to rename a tag without creating a permanent alias. For example, renaming [[orange]] to [[orange (fruit)]] would move all posts currently tagged [[orange]] to [[orange (fruit)]]. However, anyone searching for [[orange]] in the future wouldn't automatically be redirected to [[orange (fruit)]], like they would if the tag were aliased. This is appropriate when a tag is too ambiguous for an alias. For example, [[orange]] could equally mean the fruit or the color, so it wouldn't be safe to alias it to either one.

Renames are also sometimes used when a tag is too new, too small, or too little-used to warrant a permanent alias. However, if someone might try to search for the old tag, an alias should be used instead.

Please note that renames can only be submitted for tags with 200 or less posts.

To request a rename, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]rename orange -> orange_(fruit)[/code]

h4. Implications

An implication is used to make one tag automatically add another tag. For example, [[cat ears]] implies [[animal ears]] because cat ears are a type of animal ears. Adding the [[cat ears]] tag to a post will automatically add the [[animal ears]] tag too.

To request an implication, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]create implication cat_ears -> animal_ears[/code]

To request that an existing implication be removed, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]remove implication cat_ears -> animal_ears[/code]

Implications have a few rules:

* Both tags in the implication request must have wiki pages. If a tag doesn't have a wiki page yet, you should create one.
* Implications between different tag types aren't accepted. For example, implications from character tags to copyright or general tags aren't accepted.
* The subtag must make up at least 0.1% of the main tag. For example, if a tag has 10k posts, then the subtag must have at least 10 posts to imply the main tag.
* The subtag can't make up more than 90% of the main tag. For example, if a tag has 10k posts, and 9k of them are from a single subtag, then the subtag can't imply the main tag. In this case the tags are nearly the same, so an alias would probably be better.

h4. Mass updates

A mass update is used to add or remove tags to all posts in a search. For example, you could add the [[Vocaloid]] tag to all posts tagged [[Hatsune Miku]] with [code]mass update hatsune_miku -vocaloid -> vocaloid[/code].

A mass update is like a search and add, or a mass [[help:tag scripts|tag script]]. The tags on the left are searched (in this example, {{hatsune_miku -vocaloid}}), then the tags on the right are added to every matching post (in this example, [[Vocaloid]]).

A mass update should not normally be used to rename or move a tag. Mass updates are for more advanced scenarios when you need to add or remove a set of tags to a set of posts.

To request a mass update, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]mass update tag1 -> tag2[/code]

h4. Tag deprecations

Deprecating a tag means the tag is locked and can't be added to new posts. This is used for ambiguous tags, tags that are being cleaned up before they're nuked, and tags that generally shouldn't be used.

To request a tag be deprecated, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]deprecate tag_name[/code]

To undeprecate a tag, write:

* [code]undeprecate tag_name[/code]

h4. Category changes

A category change is used to change the type of a tag. For example, you can change a copyright tag (a purple tag) to a general tag (a blue tag).

To request a category change, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]category tag_name -> general[/code]

There are five category types:

* Artist (red)
* Copyright (purple)
* Character (green)
* General (blue)
* Meta (yellow)

h4. Nukes

A nuke is used to completely empty a tag or pool.

To request a nuke, write this in your bulk update request:

* [code]nuke tag[/code]
* [code]nuke pool:poolnumber[/code]

title: inbit
body:
The main antagonists in the anime [[Kikou Souseiki Mospeada]].

The [b]Inbit[/b] are an advanced insectoid biomechanical [[alien]] race that have invaded Earth and made it their new home. While most of them look like giant biomechanical [[crab]]s, some are human sized and others have even acquired a humanoid form to better adapt to Earth's conditions.

In [[real life]] they were designed by artist [[Kakinuma Hideki]] in the early [[1980s_(style)|1980s]].

title: david_bowie
body:
[b]David Robert Jones[/b] (8 January 1947 – 10 January 2016), known professionally as [b]David Bowie[/b] (/ˈboʊi/ BOH-ee), was an [[england|English]] singer, songwriter, musician, and actor. 

A leading figure in the music industry, he is regarded as one of the most influential musicians of the 20th century. Bowie was acclaimed by critics and musicians, particularly for his innovative work during the 1970s and onwards. His career was marked by reinvention and visual presentation, and his music and stagecraft had a significant impact on popular music.

h4. See also
* [[Merry Christmas Mr. Lawrence]]
* [[Labyrinth (film)|]]

title: houjou_(takagi-san)
body:
A character in [[Karakai Jouzu no Takagi-san]]. She is a middle school student who is described as "the prettiest girl in school", not only being popular amongst classmates but also mature and relaxed. [spoilers]She has a crush on [[Hamaguchi (takagi-san)|]].[/spoilers]

She has [[brown eyes]], a [[mole]] [[mole under eye|under her right eye]], and [[wavy hair|wavy]] [[medium hair|medium]] [[brown hair]] with [[braided bangs]]. On her hair, she wears a [[purple]] [[x hair ornament|x]] [[hair ornament]] and just above it, a [[purple]] [[hairclip]]. She wears a [[serafuku]] [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[blue sailor collar|blue]] [[sailor collar]], [[red neckerchief|red]] [[neckerchief]], [[white shirt|white]] [[shirt]], [[blue skirt|blue]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], and [[black socks|black]] [[kneehighs]].

She is voiced by [[Yuuki Aoi]].

title: earth_day
body:
Earth Day is an annual event on April 22 to demonstrate support for environmental protection. First held on April 22, 1970, it now includes a wide range of events coordinated globally by EARTHDAY.ORG including 1 billion people in more than 193 countries.

The Paris Climate Accords were signed on April 22, 2016 to coincide with Earth Day.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Earth Day":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Earth_Day]

title: madarame_harunobu
body:
A character from [[Genshiken]], an "uber" [[otaku]].

Madarame is a very thin, tall and tense [[Japan]]ese young man with [[glasses]], [[black hair]] and a short [[bob cut]]. He loves anime, manga and [[video game]]s to an extreme. One of his many many favorite anime characters is "[[char_aznable|Chad]]" from "[[mobile_suit_gundam|Gungal]]".

[spoilers]He had some romantic feelings towards his nemesis, [[Kasukabe Saki]] (a possible relationship outcome explored in other manga by the same author called [[Spotted Flower]]), but he officially ends up paired with [[Susanna Hopkins]] at the end of the Genshiken manga series. 

According to the Genshiken's club official "otaku" scale Madarame is at the final stage of otakuness.[/spoilers]

title: cavalry
body: A type of mobile [[soldier|infantry]] unit, typically riding a [[horse]] (though other steed such as [[camel]] and [[elephant]] were also present) and assigned either as a scout, shock troopers, mobile archers, or flankers. They were present in various warfare around the world until [[World War I]], when they were gradually replaced by motorized regiment.

title: mario_kart_8
body:
A 2014 kart racing game in the [[Mario Kart]] series developed and released by [[Nintendo]] for the [[Wii U]] in May 2014. It introduced anti-gravity driving on walls and ceilings and allows players to bump into each other for a brief boost.

An enhanced version for the [[Nintendo Switch]] titled [i]Mario Kart 8 Deluxe[/i] was released in April 2017. And throughout 2022 and 2023, an entire [i]Mario Kart's[/i] worth of courses were added to [i]Deluxe[/i] through the Booster Course Pass.

title: aldnoah.zero
body:
[b]Aldnoah.Zero[/b] (アルドノア・ゼロ [i]Arudonoa Zero[/i]) is a [[science fiction]] [[mecha]] anime series created by Olympus Knights and [[A-1 Pictures]], that began July 2014. The director is Ei Aoki and the original creator is listed as Gen Urobuchi.

h4. Synopsis

In 1972, an ancient alien hypergate was discovered on the surface of the moon. Using this technology, humanity began migrating to Mars and settling there. After settlers discovered additional advanced technology, the Vers Empire was founded, which claimed Mars and its secrets for themselves. Later, the Vers Empire declared war on Earth, and in 1999, a battle on the Moon's surface caused the hypergate to explode, shattering the Moon and scattering remnants into a debris belt around the planet. Cut off from Mars, the remnants of the Vers Empire established several massive orbital space stations within the debris belt and a ceasefire was established. 15 years later, in 2014, an attack on the Vers princess during a peace mission causes the Empire to launch a new attack on Earth, this time determined to conquer it once and for all.

title: lens_focus
body:
When the lens of a [[camera]] is given special attention due to either size or image focus. If the glass lens of the camera is not a large component of the image, then do not use as generally all cameras have lenses attached. 

Not to be confused with [[viewfinder]], which is the camera frame used to capture images.

title: deforest_kelley

He was known for his roles in Westerns and as [[Leonard Mccoy|Dr. Leonard "Bones" McCoy]] of the [[USS Enterprise]] in the television and film series [[Star Trek]] (1966–1991).

title: claudia_lasalle
body:
A female character from the [[Choujikuu Yousai Macross]] TV series. She also appears in the [[Macross: Do You Remember Love?]] movie and in archival footage and flashbacks in the [[Macross Flashback 2012]] OVA. 

[b]Claudia LaSalle[/b] is the [[united_states|American]] chief weaponry officer of the [[SDF-1]]'s bridge, [[Roy Focker]]'s girlfriend and [[Hayase Misa]]'s best friend.

In the [[Robotech]] western adaptation her name was changed to [b]Claudia Grant[/b].

title: kousaka_makoto
body:
[b]Kousaka Makoto[/b] is a jovial, handsome and high-spirited male otaku character from [[Genshiken]] who loves to smile, sleep, dress fashionable, watch anime and play [[video game]]s (at which he excels to unbelievable levels).

Kousaka has a very [[bishounen]] appearance, which is extremely rare and unusual for the classic [[otaku]] stereotype. 

[spoilers]Kousaka officially ends up paired with [[Kasukabe Saki]] during the first season of the Genshiken manga series.[/spoilers]

title: shimamura_youmu_(unadare)
body:
An [[original]] [[Touhou]] character derived from [[Konpaku Youmu]], originally based on [[Unadare]]'s "Twitter bot":[http://twitter.com/smmr_youmubot] (now deleted).

For unknown reasons, she is deeply obsessed with Fashion Center [[Shimamura]], a nationwide apparel store chain in Japan. Meanwhile, she hates [[Uniqlo]] and has her own unique views on some [[Pokemon]].

She wears a green [[vest]] with two columns of buttons, a black and white spotted [[ribbon]], a [[skirt]] with pockets, and often [[black thighhighs]]/[[black_pantyhose|pantyhose]]. Her Twitter icon depicts her wearing a red [[scarf]] and green [[beanie]]. During warmer seasons she has been depicted in a uniform similar to her normal attire. This outfit is based off a "Shimamura outfit ad":[http://blog.livedoor.jp/a24blog/archives/52762723.html].

She is often drawn with her variations, [[Uniqlo Udonge (unadare)|]] and Uniqlo Tewi.

Her twitter account was banned on December 10, 2012. The creator of the bot, [[Unadare]], commented about the incident in "his blog":[http://unadare1053.blog39.fc2.com/blog-entry-497.html] (now deleted).

h4. See also

* [[Uniqlo Udonge (unadare)|]]

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: しまむら妖夢":[http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4512175]

title: vf-1s_armored
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from [[MACROSS]].

The [b]VF-1S Armored[/b] is a variant of the [[VF-1S]] [[variable fighter]] equipped with modular [[reactive armor]] similar in function to that of modern [[tank]]s. Once used it can be jettisoned to save weight and make the mecha lighter and faster.

The armor packages are also equipped with several [[missile pod]]s, which greatly increase the mecha's firepower. However, the VF-1S is stuck in battroid mode while equipped with the armor, being only capable of transforming into fighter or [[gerwalk]] modes once the armor modules are removed during combat or jettisoned by the pilot.

h4. See also
* [[VF-1J Armored]]
other_names: アーマードバルキリー

title: pistol-grip_tool
body: The Pistol-Grip Tool (PGT) is a computer controlled [[power tool]] designed by NASA for use in space to operate as drill and screwdriver.  It was designed for use to repair the [[Hubble Space Telescope]] and was first used in 1997 and has since become standard equipment for space EVA servicing missions.  It features high torque that turns at a deliberately slow speed to be controllable in space.  Astronauts can pre-set the speed, number of turns, direction, and other features for each task which it will record all actions and settings for future reference.

title: sangonomiya_resistance_(genshin_impact)
body:
The Sangonomiya Resistance (unofficial name) is an Inazuman organization led by [[Sangonomiya Kokomi]] that opposes the Vision Hunt Decree. It is comprised of those who fear losing or have already lost their [[Vision (genshin impact)|Visions]] to the Tenryou Commission, and those who are against the Vision Hunt Decree whether they have Visions themselves or not. The resistance is based in Watatsumi Island, where the Sangonomiya Shrine is located.

title: kara_no_kyoukai
body:
Kara no Kyoukai (空の境界) is a series of novels by [[Type-Moon]]'s [[Nasu Kinoko]]. Kara no Kyoukai takes place in the same universe as the [[Fate (series)]], and features the main character named [[Ryougi Shiki]] who possesses similar powers to [[Tohno Shiki]].

It was published before [[Tsukihime]], and is considered to be a prototypical version of the game's story. Kara no Kyoukai and [[Tsukihime]] are mutually incompatible and take place in different universes.

title: kimi_no_yokogao_wo_miteita
body:
[i]Kimi no Yokogao wo Miteita[/i] (Looking at Your Profile) is a shoujo [[comic|manga]] series by [[Ichinohe Rumi]]. Published in April 13, 2022.

h4. Synopsis
[[mori hikari|Hikari's]] your typical freshmen in high school who's been recently daydreaming about [[takahashi mari|Mari’s]], her shy best friend, love story. She decides to ship Mari with Ootani-kun, their classmate, after finding out about his crush on Mari when his friend, [[asagiri (kimi no yokogao wo miteita)|Asagiri-kun]], tried getting the two to talk. The main character is Mari, the leading man is [[Ootani shintarou|Ootani]], and Hikari is the typical best friend in the story. A youthful story between four kids going through unrequited love. 

h4. Main characters
* [[Asagiri (kimi no yokogao wo miteita)|]]
* [[Mori Hikari]]
* [[Ootani Shintarou]]
* [[Takahashi Mari]]

title: sephiran_(fire_emblem)
body:
The Prime Minister of Begnion in [[Fire Emblem: Path of Radiance]] and [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]], and the main antagonist of the latter. [[Zelgius (Fire Emblem)|]], a Begnion general [spoilers]and the [[Black Knight (Fire Emblem)|]]'s true identity[/spoilers], has pledged his loyalty to him.

[spoilers]His true identity is Lehran, a Heron who founded Begnion with [[Altina (Fire Emblem)|]], with whom the first Branded was born. After the Serenes Forrest Massacre orchestrated by [[Lekain]], he loses faith in humanity and plots their destruction via the Goddess [[Ashera (Fire Emblem)|]].[/spoilers]

She has [[short_hair_with_long_locks|short]] [[brown hair]] with [[sidelocks]] and [[brown eyes]]. She wears [[black-framed eyewear|black-framed]] [[glasses]] and a [[black dress]].

title: heather_(fire_emblem)
body:
[b]Heather[/b] (ヘザー [i]Hezā[/i]) is a playable character in [[Fire Emblem: Radiant Dawn]]. A thief from Ohma village who steals to support her sick mother, by tricking gullible men into giving it to her. She’s also strongly implied to be a lesbian, as she will often flirt with and talk about wanting to meet “beautiful women,” particularly [[Nephenee (Fire Emblem)|]], while having no interest in men. Alongside [[Kyza (Fire Emblem)|]] (who’s non-binary), this makes Heather the first openly LGBTQ character in the series.

She has long, [[blonde hair]] and [[blue eyes]], and wears a [[purple_shirt]] with [[purple pants]] and a [[blue cape]]. She also wears a [[grey_headband]].

title: stationary_restraints
body:
When a character's limbs or body is held in place by objects or devices that are made of rigid materials and locked into position such that they will not budge or sway if the victim struggles.

Key examples are [[pillory|pillories]] or [[stocks]] mounted in place, shackles bolted or screwed to a surface, (such as a wall, floor, or table) cuffs holding the subject inside a [[sex machine]], and pipe arrangements built around the subject.
Restraints that are tethered by ropes or chains do not count, nor do tentacles. (be they organic or metallic)

The victim may have some freedom of movement or be bound by ropes or chains in addition, but at least one restraint must convey a sense of being made of solid materials and mounted firmly enough not to easily move or sway in response to the captive's struggling.

In some cases the restraints themselves may be able to move, such as a machine capable of posing the victim, but should appear the restrained subject does not have any influence upon the restraints.

h4.See also

* [[glory wall]]
* [[immobilization]]

body:

body:
A Chinese idle RPG for mobile. Known as Dimension Crash in Chinese and Horcrux College in Japanese.

Horcrux College is a strategy breeding game. In 2048, the AI system has become extremely advanced. However, a virus called X-MAS attacked the AI system, and the AI started to attack citizens. You are the class representative of Horcrux Academy, you will have to recruit and led the Horcrux girls to fight against AI. Your goal is to investigate the truth behind the X-MAS virus while defeating different bosses.

title: dr._mindbender
body:
[b]Dr. Mindbender[/b] is a fictional character from the [[G.I. Joe]]: A Real American Hero toyline, [[comic]] books and animated series by [[Marvel]] comics and [[Hasbro]].

He is an evil [[scientist]] who works for the [[terrorist]] organization [[Cobra Command]]; like other characters in the fictional universe, his characterization has fluctuated from that of comical villain to dangerous fascist genius depending on the release. He is often allied with [[Cobra Commander]] and [[Destro]]. 

Doctor Mindbender was first released as an action figure in 1986. "In his first live-action film appearance in 2009":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/G.I._Joe:_The_Rise_of_Cobra, he was played by American actor "Kevin J. O'Connor":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_J._O%27Connor_(actor).

title: neck_violin
body:
A [i]neck violin[/i], also called a [i]shrew's fiddle[/i] is a restraint similar to a [[pillory]], [[stocks]], or [[yoke (bdsm)|]].  It is normally composed of two pieces of wood hinged together.  There are holes in the boards such that when it is closed it will wrap around the neck with an opening at the front to restrain the wrists.

Some variations of this restraint were used to restrain two people and have them locked facing each other.

title: easter
body:
Easter, also called Pascha (Greek/Latin) or Resurrection Sunday, is a festival and holiday celebrating the resurrection of [[Jesus]] from the dead. In Christian faith, Jesus died [[crucifixion|on the cross]] on Good Friday and was buried. On Easter Sunday, He revived and returned to Heaven to be with the Almighty Father.

Informally, Easter is celebrated with imagery of the [[Easter Bunny]], who is purported to leave decorated baskets of candy and chocolates for children. [[Easter egg]]s are painted and hidden throughout a location for children to find as a festive activity. Since Easter frequently occurs in either March or April, it also uses images and colors related to the season of spring.

h4.See also

* [[Happy Easter]]

title: wargreymon_x-antibody
body:
Ultimate-level Dragon Man Digimon. War Greymon X is the form of [[wargreymon|War Greymon]] when empowered by the X-Antibody. The iconic [u]Brave Shield[/u] as seen on the regular War Greymon is now gone; all its defensive attributes have been imparted unto the [u]Dramon Killer[/u] gauntlets. On top of its preexisting [i]Gaia Force[/i] Special Move, it can now harness the power of water in a similar fashion, pooling it together into a giant sphere of water that it then brings down ([i]Poseidon Force[/i]).

Together with [[metalgarurumon_x|Metal Garurumon X]], it can become [[Omegamon X-antibody]].

title: gremlin_(mythology)
body:
A small-sized mischievous folklore creature, first originated as a slang from the British aviation community in 1920s. The creature's popular depiction featured in 1984 [i][[Gremlins (film)|]][/i] with huge ears and fangs has later codified gremlin into fantasy worldbuilding.

h4. See also
* [[Goblin]]

title: goblin
body:
An intelligent humanoid [[creature]], essentially a weaker, smaller, and smarter version of [[orc|orcs]]. They appear prominently throughout the broader fantasy media sphere in movies, tabletop games, video games, novels, and more, typically in antagonistic roles.

Goblins are most commonly portrayed as child-sized or human-sized creatures with green skin, [[fangs]], [[pointy nose|pointy noses]], and [[pointy_ears|large pointy ears]]. Some media exaggerate their appearance further by giving them [[oversized limbs|oversized]] ears, often half the size of their face.

Like their larger counterparts, goblins are usually depicted as arch-enemies of [[elf|elves]], and are often allied with orcs for this reason.

h4.See also
* [[Chaneque]]
* [[Gremlin (mythology)|]]
* [[female goblin]]

It resembles an [[Eastern Dragon]] with its long body and gray and green scales. They have two [[bulging_eyes|bulging]] [[blank_eyes|white eyes]], [[lantern|]]s around their body and a pair of pants with two belts. They also have a twin [[mohawk]]s and in their mouth is plate that is used to charge its [[booyah bomb (splatoon)|]] attack.

title: bodypaint
body:
Painted marks, symbols or designs on a person's body. Can be either full-bodied or various small marks. Often used by [[tribal]] cultures.

Not to be confused with [[paint on body]] which is for [[paint splatter]]s on a character's body.

[[Cammy White]] from [[Street Fighter]] shows an example of bodypaint, she has it as stripes on her legs.

Also tag as [[painted clothes]] if the paint is used to replace clothes.

See [[body writing]] for words written on the body.

h4. Related tags

* [[facepaint]]
* [[body markings]]
* [[markings]]
* [[tattoo]]
* [[paint stains]]

title: mother_(yoru_mac)
body:
The nameless mother character from the "first commercial":[/posts/6702154] in the Autumn 2023 [[Yoru Mac]] commercial set made for [[McDonald's]] Japan.

In parallel to the commercial she was featured in unexpectedly gaining popularity, she similarly saw unexpected attention among western art communities as the "McDonald's [[mature female|MILF]]" and has spawned fanart in the process. In Japan, meanwhile, the nickname "McMother" caught on.

title: pepsiman
body:
[[Pepsi]]'s superhero mascot in Japan, who debuted in 1996. In 1999, he received his own video game, developed for the Playstation 1. In his most well-known look, he wears a full body covering [[blue bodysuit|blue]] and [[white bodysuit|white]] [[bodysuit]] with the Pepsi logo on the chest. His lesser-known early look features a similar bodysuit, but in white and red.

h4.See also

* "Wikipedia article":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pepsiman_(video_game)]

title: yatagarasu_(tsukumo_sana)
body: [[Tsukumo Sana]]'s [[mascot]] who bears no resemblance with [[yatagarasu|its namesake]]. Essentially an orange [[worm]]-like creature with simple face and an arm, with a star navigator ring surrounds its body. Sana says its true form would "melt humans' brains", so it has this form.

title: gloom_(irys)
body:
One of [[Irys (Hololive)|IRyS]]'s [[mascot]]s and the counterpart to [[Bloom (Irys)|]]. A [[black cat]] with a [[triangle mouth]] and a single [[blue_eyes|blue eye]] mirroring its owner’s [[heterochromia]]. Its fur is patterned like a tuxedo with accompanying [[bowtie]]. Has a [[single wing|single]] [[detached wings|detached wing]] on its right side.

Gloom was designed by Hololive English vtuber [[tsukumo_sana|Tsukumo Sana]] with input from IRyS and her chat.

Has a [[single wing|single]] [[detached wings|detached wing]] on its left side.

Bloom was designed by Hololive English vtuber [[tsukumo_sana|Tsukumo Sana]] with input from IRyS and her chat.

title: fbi
body:
The [b]Federal Bureau of Investigation[/b] ([b]FBI[/b]) is the domestic intelligence and security service of the [[United States]] and its principal federal law enforcement agency.

Established in 1908, the FBI operates as both an intelligence agency and a federal law enforcement organization. Its primary mission is to protect and defend the United States against terrorist and foreign intelligence threats, uphold and enforce the criminal laws of the country, and provide leadership and criminal justice services to federal, state, municipal, and international agencies and partners.

Headquartered in "Washington, D.C.":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Washington,_D.C, the FBI operates field offices across the United States and in select locations around the world. Its agents, trained in various investigative and tactical disciplines, work in close collaboration with other law enforcement agencies and international partners to address complex and multifaceted criminal and national security threats.

Frequently used for memes related to loli fans.

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia: Federal Bureau of Investigation":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Bureau_of_Investigation]

title: the_stranger_(camus)
body:
A 1942 French Novella written by author "Albert Camus":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Albert_Camus. Detailing the story of Meursault, a settler within French Algeria who weeks after his mothers funeral, shoots and kills an Arab Man. The Stranger has become critically acclaimed due to it's themes of absurdism and existentialism alongside its philosophical outlook and syntactic structure.

The Stranger is most famously known for its opening line; "Maman died today. Or yesterday maybe, I don't know."

title: coco_jumbo
body:
A [[turtle]] from [[JoJo no Kimyou na Bouken]] Part 5. When a special jeweled key is inserted in the depression on the turtle's shell, it becomes the entrance to a spacious room. Both people and inanimate objects can enter this area. The quality is similar to a hotel room, though it is unknown how the lights, television, and refrigerator within are able to operate.

This room is the effect of the turtle's [[Stand (jojo)|]], "Mister President".

Namesake is the song by German euro-dance group Mr. President, "Coco Jamboo". Its Stand, of course, is named after the group itself.

title: spartas
body:
A [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] science fiction anime series from the 80s.

The [b]ATAC-01-SCA "Spartas"[/b] is a heavy armored and heavy armed variable geometry multi-role combat mecha used by the [[ATAC]].

It is equipped with a triple barreled ion cannon in its left arm weapon pack, a heavy 150mmm smoothbore cannon/missile launcher in its right arm weapon pack and a [[beam rifle]]. 

Each Spartas has the ability to transform into 3 modes: Hover [[tank]] vehicle ("Sniping Clapper"), [[GERWALK]] ("Walking Cannon"), and Robot ("Battle Sniper"). 

Models differ depending on the rank of the individual and can be upgraded according to their use. The Spartas can also be modified for effective [[space]] combat and is capable of anti-aircraft operations.

The Spartas is [[Jeanne Francaix]]'s mecha of choice.

It was renamed as the [b]VERITECH HOVERTANK[/b] ([b]V[/b]ariable [b]E[/b]ngineering and [b]R[/b]obotics [b]I[/b]ntegration [b]TECH[/b]nology [b]HOVER[/b]ing [b]TANK[/b]) in the [[ROBOTECH]] adaptation.

title: summoner_aldra
body:
[b]Summoner [[aldra_(queen's_blade)|Aldra]][/b] (召喚士アルドラ) is a [[Queen's Blade Rebellion]] character. Voiced by [[Taketatsu Ayana]], designed by [[Kantaka]]. This form of Aldra depicts her after relinquishing her "Queen" title and went on to settle a family instead.

Similar with the original depiction of Aldra, she has long [[silver hair]] in a [[ponytail]] and [[red eyes]]. Summoner Aldra wears an [[apron]], [[purple panties]] and [[thighhighs]] she fights with a boat oar and her demon powers. Notably, in [[Queen's Blade Limit Break]], Summoner Aldra were depicted in her original design rather than being modified to fit [[Aldra (Queen's Blade Unlimited)|her redesign from Queen's Blade Unlimited]].

Summoner Aldra's combat book: pool #2111

[[phoenix wright: ace attorney - spirit of justice|Spirit of Justice]] character, serving as a witness during Turnabout Storyteller. She is a [[clown]] specializing in balloon art, with prominent [[large breasts]]. [spoiler]Her breasts are in fact balloons covering up a flat chest, revealed upon her breakdown in court, after which she takes off her wig too.[/spoiler]

In mid-2022, Geiru would trend on social media following the release of an Ace Attorney "animation":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wVAHr53KoBQ] by [[Speedoru]], sparking a wave of [[clussy (phrase)|]] fever. Liberties would often be taken with her [spoiler]fake balloon breasts by presenting them as real.[/spoiler]



She has [[black eyes]] and [[medium hair|medium]] [[pink hair]] [spoiler]which is actually a [[wig]] - her natural hair is [[straight hair|straight]] and [[black hair|black]], exposing her [[forehead]] on which she has a [[bandaid on forehead|bandaid]][/spoiler].

She wears a [[red nose|red]] [[clown nose]], a [[rainbow choker|rain]][[multicolored choker|bow]] [[choker]], a [[pink shirt|pink]] [[shirt]] with [[buttons]] and [[short sleeves|short]] [[white sleeves|white]] [[feather sleeves]], a pair of [[suspenders]], a pair of [[pink gloves|pink]] [[elbow gloves|elbow]] [[gloves]], a [[pink skirt|pink]] [[layered skirt|layered]] [[frilled skirt|frilled]] [[miniskirt|mini]][[skirt]] with a [[white bow|white]] [[wing-shaped bow|wing-shaped]] [[bow]], and [[pink footwear|pink]] [[winged footwear|winged]] [[high heels|high-heeled]] [[pumps]].

title: sauna
body:
A sauna is a small room or house designed as a place to experience dry or wet heat sessions, or an establishment with one or more of these and auxiliary facilities.

A sauna session can be a social affair in which the participants disrobe and sit or recline in temperatures typically between 70°C (158 °F) and 100°C (212 °F). This induces relaxation and promotes sweating.

Saunas can be divided into two basic styles: conventional saunas that warm the air or infrared saunas that warm objects. Infrared saunas may use various materials in their heating area such as charcoal, active carbon fibers, and other materials.

title: decagrammaton_(blue_archive)
body:
Decagrammaton is an artificial intelligence and computer virus that takes a form of a vending machine, who claims itself to be a divine seeker. It is also known as the new God, created by an analysis system that is independent of the Absolute.

The Ten Prophets — its followers — appear in various places in Kivotos. While their true objective is unknown, some believe it to be a high threat to Kivotos itself.

The first appearance of Decagrammaton is from "特殊作戦 デカグラマトン編" (Special Operations: Decagrammaton)

h4. Lore:

[spoiler]
Although the process in which Decagrammaton appoints its Prophets is not yet clear, there are two possible theories formed by two prominent individuals from Millennium Science School on Decagrammaton's methodology. Seminar president Rio's theory is that Decagrammaton utilizes its immense hacking capabilities to hack into the victim AI's personality modules. Ex-Veritas head Himari, on the other hand, believes that Decagrammaton "brainwashes" the AI; or rather, to put it more aptly, Decagrammaton "inspires" the AI. Regardless of the method, the result is the same, and the AI is still an independent being from Decagrammaton. Himari describes this process as irrational to typical AI standards, where the logical and efficient move is to integrate the controlled AI into itself.
[/spoiler]

title: tc_salamander
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]TC Salamander[/b] is a manned main [[battle]] [[robot]] used by the Tactic Corps for high-mobility heavy-weapons support. It is a non-variable geometry unit armed with a similar [[beam rifle]] to the one used by the [[Spartas]] and the [[CDU Unicorn]]. 

The arms of the mecha have reinforced armor to assist in parrying attacks. There is a thruster in its back to assist the mecha in leaping.

title: cdu_unicorn
body:
A fictional [[mecha]] from the [[Choujikuu Kidan Southern Cross]] [[science fiction]] anime series from the 80s.

The [b]CDU Unicorn[/b] is a manned main [[battle]] [[robot]] used by the Civilian Defense Units for protecting urban and colonial settlements in [[Planet Glorie]]. It is a non-variable geometry mecha armed with a similar [[beam rifle]] to the one used by the [[Spartas]] and the [[TC Salamander]].

title: commissar_caiphas_cain
body: Ciaphas Cain (HERO OF THE IMPERIUM) is one of the more well-known commissars in [[Warhammer 40K]]. He is the protagonist of a namesake series of novels by Sandy Mitchell, written as an in-setting memoir. In them, he contrasts the propaganda surrounding him by portraying himself as a self-serving coward who only got fortunate time and again.

title: death_korps_of_krieg
body:
[[Astra Militarum]] military faction in [[Warhammer 40K]]. The Death Korps, sometimes called "Kriegers", hail from the irradiated death world of Krieg. Specialized in siege and trench warfare, they have garnered infamy for their obsession with sacrificing themselves for the sins of their rebellious ancestors and their impersonal, gas-masked appearance.

title: barrett_m82
body:
A short recoil-operated, semi-automatic [[anti-materiel rifle]] developed by the American Barrett Firearms Manufacturing company and chambered in the monstrous .50 BMG (12.7 × 99 mm) cartridge. The M82 was the first rifle chambered in 50 BMG to be mass produced for the civilian market. Used by many units and armies around the world for anti-material, anti-armor, anti-emplacement and sometimes long range antipersonnel use, it is also called the "Light Fifty" for it cartridge.
  
The weapon is found in two variants, the original M82A1 (and A3) and the bullpup [[Barrett M82A2|M82A2]]. This tag also covers the Barrett M107A1, the "child" of the M82. 

The Barrett 50 is also very common in cinema, most notably appearing in [[Robocop]] as the "Cobra Assault cannon".

h4. See also

* [[Barrett M82A2]]
* [[List of weapons]]

title: siphon
body:
From [i]Oxford Dictionaries Online[/i]: A tube used to convey liquid upwards from a reservoir and then down to a lower level of its own accord. Once the liquid has been forced into the tube, typically by suction or immersion, flow continues unaided.

For so-called a syphon coffee maker, use [[coffee maker]] instead.

h4. External links
* "Oxford Dictionaries Online: Siphon":https://en.oxforddictionaries.com/definition/siphon
* "Wikipedia: Siphon":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Siphon

title: coffee_siphon
body:
A type of [[coffee maker]] consisting of a flask and a funnel/filter.

It works by having one put a small heat source under the flask filled with water. Hot water vapor pressure then pushes water up into the funnel. Coffee is added to the funnel and mixed in. Then, with the heat source taken away, a vacuum in the flask pulls the coffee back through the filter and into the lower flask again. The filter can then be detached, and the flask and base of the siphon used to serve the coffee.

h4. See also

* [[coffee maker]]
* [[coffee pot]]
* [[coffee]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Vacuum coffee maker":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Vacuum_coffee_maker]

title: moka_pot
body:
A [[coffee maker]] that looks similar to a metal [[kettle]].  It brews coffee by passing boiling water pressurized by steam through ground coffee.  It is named after the Yemeni city of Mocha.

The moka pot is composed of a bottom chamber, a metal funnel shaped filter, and an upper collecting chamber.  The water is boiled in the lower chamber where pressure forces it up and through the filter with the coffee grounds and into the upper collecting chamber.

h4. See also

* [[Cappuccino]]
* [[Bialetti]]
* [[l'omino coi baffi]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Moka pot":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Moka_pot]

title: bialetti
body:
Alfonso Bialetti (1888–1970) was an engineer who became famous for acquiring Luigi De Ponti's invention of the [[moka pot|Moka Express]] [[coffee maker|coffeemaker]]. Designed in 1933, the [[coffee pot]] has been a style icon since the 1950s. It is the source of nostalgia and affection for many Italians and is an essential and fashionable part of almost every Italian kitchen. While many variations of the Moka have been developed, including the [[Bialetti]] [[cow print|cow-printed]] Mukka Express (which makes [[cappuccino]]), the Moka Express is a time-honoured classic. Bialetti was also the founder of Bialetti Industrie S.p.A, the now giant Italian kitchen-ware company.

h4. See also

* [[l'omino coi baffi]]
* [[moka pot]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfonso_Bialetti]
* "Official website":[https://www.bialetti.com/]

title: espresso_machine
body:
A specific kind of [[coffee maker|coffee maker]] that forces pressurized water near boiling point through a "puck" of ground coffee and a filter to thicken and concentrate the coffee into [[espresso (drink)|espresso]] shots.

Use if a grouphead and portafilter or group handle attached with a handle is visible. May refer to an enlarged commercial version used in coffee shops and cafés.

title: el_filibusterismo
body:
[b]El filibusterismo[/b] (transl. [i]The filibusterism[/i]; [i]The Subversive[/i] or [i]The Subversion[/i], as in the Locsín [[English text]] translation, are also possible translations), also known by its alternative English title [b]The Reign of Greed[/b], is the second novel written by [[philippines|Filipino]] national hero "José Rizal":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jos%C3%A9_Rizal. 

It is the sequel to "Noli Me Tángere":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Noli_Me_T%C3%A1ngere_(novel) and, like the first book, it was written in [[spanish_text|Spanish]].

title: ellen_baker
body:
An English teacher that first appeared in [[NEW HORIZON]]'s English language middle school textbooks with the 2016 edition, that got famous on "Twitter":[https://web.archive.org/web/20160407044338/https://twitter.com/haiyore_audio/status/717306000307453952], which prompted many artists to draw her, to such an extent that it prompted worry from the original artist and publisher.

Has [[blonde hair]] in a sidewards [[ponytail]] held together with a [[hair scrunchie]], with [[green eyes|green]] or [[blue eyes]]. Often portrayed in a [[blue coat|blue overcoat]]/[[blue jacket|jacket]] with a [[white shirt]] underneath and [[brown pants]]/[[long skirt|long brown skirt]]. She has a famous pose of her swinging a bat, [[baker at bat]].

Would be replaced in the middle school textbooks starting from 2021, having moved to the elementary school textbooks with the 2020 edition, albeit changed with a brand new design as a result of an art style change. Another "tweet":[https://twitter.com/Akikun1124/status/1718997540153283062] featuring her went viral in 2023 resulting in more people finding out where she had gone.

h4. External links

* "Crunchyroll - Twitter Falls In Love With Japanese Text Book's Super-Kawaii English Teacher":[http://www.crunchyroll.com/anime-news/2016/04/05/twitter-falls-in-love-with-japanese-text-books-super-kawaii-english-teacher]
* "English textbook characters get anime-style makeover to appeal to linguists and otaku alike | RocketNews24":http://en.rocketnews24.com/2016/04/06/english-textbook-characters-get-anime-style-makeover-to-appeal-to-linguists-and-otaku-alike/

title: venus_of_willendorf
body: A small limestone sculpture discovered near Willendorf, a village in Lower Austria. It is estimated to be 25,000–30,000 years old. The sculpture portrays a nude woman with [[huge_breasts|huge]], [[sagging_breasts|sagging]] breasts and [[fat]] or [[obese]] proportions, with both arms placed in a [[breast suppress]] pose. Notable for being among the earliest known works expressing fat fetishism, as it is commonly interpreted.

title: kokopelli
body: Kokopelli is a fertility deity, usually depicted as a humpbacked [[flute]] player (often with [[feathers]] or [[antennae]]-like protrusions on his head), who is venerated by some [[Native American]] cultures in the Southwestern [[United States]]. Like most fertility deities, Kokopelli presides over both childbirth and agriculture. He is also a trickster god and represents the spirit of music.

title: hanging_light
body:
A light fixture that hangs from the [[ceiling]] by a chain, cord, or metal rod. They are a common light source over [[kitchen]] counters and [[restaurant]] tables.

This tag is distinct from [[chandelier]] in that chandeliers are large fixtures that branch out into multiple lamps, whereas hanging lights are of simple design and only have one or two lamps each. Hanging lights are often arranged in multiples to evenly illuminate an area.

h4. See also

* [[ceiling light]]
* [[string of light bulbs]]
* [[wall lamp]]

title: christmas_lights
body:
A string of colorful lights wrapped around [[christmas_tree|Christmas trees]] and strung around fixtures to produce colored illuminations during the holidays.

For large strings of lights not associated with [[Christmas]], see [[string of light bulbs]].

title: string_of_light_bulbs
body:
Long strands of usually globe-shaped [[light bulb]]s suspended between two or more points for decorative illumination.

They are larger than [[Christmas lights]], and unlike Christmas lights they are often hung year-round to provide festive lighting for spaces such as bars or patios.

Also known as [b]café lights[/b] or [b]festoon lighting[/b]. 

h4. See also

* [[hanging light]]
* [[christmas lights]]

title: extra
body:
Instead of using this tag, consider creating the appropriate chartag for the character you're trying to identify.

* If the character has an official name or a widely used fan name, simply use that: for example, [[Tachibana Himeko]]
* If the character is part of an organization, you can use the organization's name: for example, [[Justice Task Force Member (Blue Archive)]]
* If the character has no affiliation, use their major traits to name the tag: for example, [[Dark Haired Kappa]], [[Office Lady (Madoka Magica)]]

To create a character tag, simply write "char:" followed by the tag you want to create. For example, [code]char:tachibana_himeko[/code].

title: kitagawa_marin
body:
One of the main characters in [[Sono Bisque Doll wa Koi wo Suru]]. She is a high school student who is not only popular but also has a passion for [[cosplay]], especially her [[Kuroe Shizuku|favorite character]], [[Kuroe Shizuku (cosplay)|]].

She has [[red eyes]], [[medium breasts]], and [[long hair|long]] [[multicolored hair|multicolored]] [[blonde hair]] to [[red hair|red]] [[gradient hair]] with [[swept bangs]]. She wears both [[earrings]] and several [[ear piercing|piercing]]s, (including an [[industrial piercing]]), a [[black collar]] or  [[black choker|black]] [[lace choker]], [[bracelet]], [[necklace]], and a [[school uniform]] consisting of a [[tied shirt|tied]] [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt|collared]] [[dress shirt]], a [[blue necktie|blue]] or [[grey necktie]], a [[blue skirt|blue]] [[plaid skirt|plaid]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[miniskirt]], [[black socks|black]] [[ankle socks]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

Other Attire: [[Halterneck]] [[black bikini|black]] [[string bikini|string]] [[side-tie bikini bottom|side-tie]] [[bikini]] with a [[floral print]]

Voiced by: [[Suguta Hina]] (JPN), [[Monarch_(amalee)|Amanda "AmaLee" Lee]] (ENG)

h4. External links

title: northampton_(kancolle)
body:
[i][[Kantai Collection]][/i]'s depiction of USS [i]Northampton[/i] (CL/CA-26), which was the nameship of six Northampton-class cruiser of the United States Navy. She is named after the city of "Northampton, Massachusetts":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Northampton,_Massachusetts].

Visually, Northampton has [[long_hair|long]] [[blonde hair]] with [[blunt bangs]], [[green eyes]], and a [[large_breasts|well-endowed chest]] as well as [[semi-rimless_eyewear|partly framed glasses]], making her the second ever glasses-wearing foreign shipgirl, the first among the Allies. She wears a stylized [[naval uniform]] similar to the one seen in sister [[Houston_(kancolle)|]]:  A [[corset]], white ribbed sleeves, and a [[black_skirt|black]] [[pencil skirt]], a [[black_pantyhose|black]] [[thighband pantyhose]], [[shin guards]], and high-heeled [[rudder footwear]]. She also has a white peaked cap. Her machinery consists of a [[smokestack]], a crane, and two large cannon turrets, each having three barrels. Houston has a remodelled form where torpedo launchers are added to her machinery among other upgrades and a darker paint job and she switches to black ribbed sleeves.

In her damaged CG in both forms, a PT boat is seen, presumably PT-109 which rescued several survivors of her sinking during Battle of Tassafaronga. Other survivors were saved by the crew of USS [[Fletcher_(kancolle)|]] using cork-floated cargo nets. Fans used this as a connection for shipgirl Northamption somewhat resembling an older and taller shipgirl Fletcher.

Clipped on Northampton's hair to the right is a [[Navy cross]], similar to the one posthumously awarded to Chief Engineer/Commander Hilan Ebert, the most senior officer aboard the historical cruiser who was killed during the Battle of Tassafaronga. Her captain, Willard A. Kitts, was also awarded the Navy Cross for his handling of the evacuation, although he survived her sinking.

The historical Northampton was launched from Fore River Shipyard in Quincy, Massachusetts on 5 September 1929 and was sunk by torpedos in the Battle of Tassafaronga, on 30 November 1942.

h4. See Also
* [[Northampton (Azur Lane)]]
* [[Northampton (Warship Girls R)]]
* [[list of Kantai Collection characters]]
* "Wikipedia: USS Northampton (CA-26)":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/USS_Northampton_(CA-26)]

She has [[yellow eyes]], [[medium hair|medium lengthed]] [[red hair]] stylized with [[crossed bangs|crossed]] [[bangs]], [[sidelocks]], and [[hair over shoulder|over her shoulders]], and has [[large breasts]]. She also has yellow [[hairclip]]s on her hair.

Her [[school uniform]] consists of a [[white shirt|white]] [[collared shirt]], [[pink cardigan|pink]] [[cardigan]], [[black skirt|black]] [[pleated skirt|pleated]] [[skirt]], [[black thighhighs]], and [[brown footwear|brown]] [[loafers]].

title: kazanari_tsubasa
body:
She's one of the six main protagonists of the [[Senki Zesshou Symphogear]] series.

She is a Symphogear user and wields the Ame no Habakiri relic.

Tsubasa is a tall girl with blue hair and dark blue eyes. She has a side ponytail on the left side of her head that is longer than the rest of her hair, which falls to just above her waist and is cut straight.

Her Zwei Wing concert clothes consist of a high collared crop top with white shorts and a low belted pleated skirt cut diagonally from her left hip. A large light blue bow and left wing are seen on her bustle. She also wears white and blue stocking up to her thigh, and light blue boots with the left one reaching to her knee and the right reaching to her ankle.

She is also seen wearing the Lydian Music Academy uniform.

title: amou_kanade
body:
Character from [[Senki Zesshou Symphogear]].

She was [[Kazanari Tsubasa|Tsubasa's]] former partner who fought alongside her, and a member of Zwei Wing.

She was a Symphogear user and wielded the Gungnir relic before her death.

Kanade was a tall girl who had long fluffy red hair with a shape of a feather that falls down to her waist and red eyes. She wears a short sleeveless and collar-bearing green shirt and denim short-shorts as her casual attire.

Her Zwei Wing concert clothes consisted of a light pink and hot pink strapless pleated dress with a light yellow petticoat, a large coral colored bow and a right wing on her bustle. She wore it with a light pink scarf and white heels.

As seen in Episode 4 her training attire was a white T-shirt and red shorts. She has also been seen in a mechanic outfit, in Episode 9.

In the manga, it was shown that Kanade has a tattoo of a wing on her back.

title: qual_(sousou_no_frieren)
body: Qual, also known as the Elder Sage of Corruption,  is a demon who served the Demon King and is the creator of Zoltraak.

title: durandal_(symphogear)
body:
Durandal is one of the very few complete relics in existence. It has been designated as the fifth relic and is currently under the care and supervision of Section Two.

Durandal is the sword of Charlemagne's paladin Roland. The sword is said to be the sharpest sword in all existence.

title: x-drive_(symphogear)
body:
This form is concealed within the Symphogear relics under 301,655,722 locks, and can only be unlocked under a high-level phonic gain. The X-Drive appears to only last for one use before the user's Symphogear reverts to their normal form at whatever level they had last naturally unlocked it at.

When the X-Drive is active, the Symphogear gains a predominantly-white color scheme and enhanced design, universally including the addition of angelic wings formed of colored light. In this state, all Symphogears, regardless of their normal abilities, are capable of unassisted flight both in the Earth's atmosphere and in space. They can also communicate telepathically with each other, and others such as Finé. All of the user's normal attacks can still be utilized, but at such a drastically greater level of both power and scope that destroying an entire army of Noise is an easy task, and even standing up to a fully-energized complete relic becomes possible. On top of this, the X-Drive can be used to bolster the strength of another wielded relic, such as Solomon's Cane or [[Durandal (symphogear)|Durandal]].

The X-Drive's particular form and strength is based off the current level of power the Symphogear has achieved before unlocking it, as [[Tachibana Hibiki (symphogear)|Hibiki]], [[Kazanari Tsubasa|Tsubasa]] and [[Yukine Chris|Chris]] all possessed radically different X-Drive forms when they unlocked them again in G compared to their forms in season 1.

title: stickleback
body: The sticklebacks are a family of ray-finned fishes, the Gasterosteidae which have a Holarctic distribution in fresh, brackish and marine waters.

title: hyuganatsu
body: Hyuganatsu is a citrus fruit and plant grown in Japan. The name comes from Hyūga, the ancient name of Miyazaki Prefecture in Kyushu, where the citrus is said to have originated, while "natsu" means summer.

title: kuva
body:
Kuva is an exceedingly rare red fluid coveted by the Grineer Queens. It can be obtained in Kuva Missions, and is used to cycle Rivens or build rare blueprints.


see also:

[[warframe]]

title: khachapuri
body: Khachapuri is a traditional Georgian dish of cheese-filled bread. The bread is leavened and allowed to rise, molded into various shapes, and then filled in the center with a mixture of cheese, eggs, and other ingredients. The bread crust is traditionally torn off and dipped into the cheese.

title: meganeura
body: Meganeura is a genus of extinct insects from the Late Carboniferous. They resembled and are related to the present-day dragonflies and damselflies, and were predatory, with their diet mainly consisting of other insects.

title: hangingfly
body: Bittacidae is a family of scorpionflies commonly called hangingflies or hanging scorpionflies.
