title: akaname
body:
A [[traditional youkai]] known to live in bathrooms, and come out at night when nobody is around, to lick the various dirty surfaces clean; hence their name, which means "filth licker".

h4. See also

* [[Akaname-san]]

title: narada_(starship)
body:
A fictional massive [[alien]] [[spacecraft]] from the [i][[Star Trek]][/i] series.

The [b]Narada[/b] is an advanced, powerful and heavily armed [[Romulan]] spacecraft, originally a simple mining freighter before being outfitted with [[Borg]] nanotechnology, used to stop the supernova that threatened to destroy Romulus, the home planet of the Romulans. It is commanded by [i]Nero[/i].

title: romulan
body:
A fictional humanoid [[alien]] race from the [[Star Trek]] series.

The [b]Romulans[/b] are a war mongering alien race who constantly develop new and powerful weaponry with the goal of expanding its [i]Romulan Star Empire[/i].

Physically they resemble the [[Vulcan]] race, since both races have the same origin.

h4.See also

* [[Romulan Warbird]]
* [[Narada (starship)]]

title: coping_saw
body:
A coping saw is a type of [[saw]] with a C-shaped frame and narrow blade used for cutting intricate external shapes and interior cut-outs in wood.  Unlike a [[hacksaw]], the handle is parallel and at the same level as the blade.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Coping saw":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Coping_saw

title: hacksaw
body:
A type of handsaw with a C-shaped frame holding a blade under tension, used for cutting through metal.

h4. See also 

* [[Bonesaw]]
* [[Coping saw]]
* [[Japanese saw]]

title: japanese_saw
body:
A pull saw that cuts on the opposite stroke (push) from [[hand saw]]s.

The most common type is the "ryoba", which is rectangular or trapezoidal and has two cutting edges, i.e., a saw on both sides: one for cross-cutting, and one for ripping.

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Japanese_saw]

title: hand_saw
body: The stereotypical appearance of a western [[saw]]: a solid saw blade, with a wooden or plastic handle that saws by pushing and pulling. In contrast, [[Japanese saw]]s can have one or two serrated edges with a long wooden handle, more like a knife.

title: drepanosaurus
body: Drepanosaurus is a genus of arboreal reptile that lived during the Triassic Period. It is a member of the Drepanosauridae, a group of diapsid reptiles known for their prehensile tails.

title: lystrosaurus
body: Lystrosaurus is an extinct genus of herbivorous dicynodont therapsids from the late Permian and Early Triassic epochs. It lived in what is now Antarctica, India, China, Mongolia, European Russia and South Africa.

title: smena_(camera)
body: Smena (Russian: Смена, Eng: "Change") is a series of low-cost 35 mm film cameras manufactured in the Soviet Union by the LOMO factory from 1953 to 1991.

title: ulemosaurus
body: Ulemosaurus is an extinct genus of dinocephalian therapsids that lived 265 to 260 million years ago, at Isheevo in Russian Tatarstan. It was a tapinocephalid, a group of bulky herbivores which flourished in the Middle Permian. Ulemosaurus and other tapinocephalians disappeared at the end of the Middle Permian.

title: do_androids_dream_of_electric_sheep?
body:
[b]Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?[/b] is a [[science fiction]] novel by [[united_states|American]] writer [[Philip K. Dick]] first published in 1968. The main plot follows [[Rick Deckard]], a bounty hunter of renegade [[android]]s, while the secondary plot follows John Isidore, a man of sub-normal intelligence who befriends some of the androids. 

The novel is set in a post-apocalyptic near future, where the Earth and its populations have been damaged greatly by Nuclear War during World War Terminus. Most types of animals are endangered or extinct due to extreme radiation poisoning from the war. To own an animal is a sign of status, but what is emphasized more is the empathic emotions humans experience towards an animal. 

Deckard is faced with "retiring" six escaped [i]Nexus-6[/i] model androids, the latest and most advanced model. Because of this task, the novel explores the issue of what it is to be human. Unlike humans, the androids possess no empathic sense. In essence, Deckard probes the existence of defining qualities that separate humans from androids. 

The book's plot served as the primary basis for the 1982 sci-fi film [[Blade Runner]]. 

Japanese title: アンドロイドは電気羊の夢を見るか?

h4. External links
* "Wikipedia article":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Do_Androids_Dream_of_Electric_Sheep%3F
other_names: アンドロイドは電気羊の夢を見るか

title: pkd_blaster
body:
The [b]Phlanger-Katsumata "Doppelgänger" (PKD) series blaster[/b] is a futuristic looking and very powerful and devastating [[handgun]] from the 1982 [[cyberpunk]] movie [[Blade Runner]].

Because of its stopping power it is the weapon of choice of most Blade Runners when "[[murder|retiring]]" [[Replicant]]s. 

The name of the weapon shares the same initials from the [[real life]] [[science fiction]] author [[Philip K. Dick]] as a tribute, since he wrote [[do_androids_dream_of_electric_sheep?|the short story on which the movie was based]]. The prop for the film was developed using parts from a [[revolver]] and the firing mechanism of an old Austrian battle [[rifle]].

title: risty_(queen's_blade)
body:

She has long [[red hair]] and purple eyes, with a peculiarily [[revealing clothes|revealing]] set of padded [[bikini armor]]. She fights with a mace and shield.

title: gundam_msv
body:
The [b]Mobile Suit Variations[/b], simply known as [b]MSV[/b] to fans, are variations on the mechanical designs of [[Gundam]] franchise, particularly those of [[Mobile Suit Gundam]]. Most of them never appeared in animated form.

These [[mobile suit]] [[mecha]] variations are official designs, including their own histories and in many cases their own pilots with detailed backstories. Some were cancelled or alternative designs originally created for an animated production, while others are promotional variations used as the basis for unique [[gunpla|model kits]]. 

While never seen in their own animation series, most of the MSV machines (as well as the backstories and pilots created for them) are considered canonical, and a feature in other side-stories, manga, or (mostly) in [[video game]]s.
other_names: モビルスーツバリエーション

title: compa
body:
Young nurse-in-training who finds [[neptune (neptunia)|Neptune]] stuck headfirst in the ground near her home at the beginning of [[Choujigen Game Neptune]]. Compa is a polite and timid girl who can get tough when the going gets tough. Her choice in attire is what appears to be a wool [[sweater]] with [[detached sleeves]], a rather short [[pleated skirt|pleated]], [[plaid skirt]] with [[kneehighs|kneesocks]] that are lined with hearts at the top. Her boots appear to be made of the same material as her sweater. She also wears a choker with a heart that has a "C" in it and carries a black hip purse that is adorned with hearts and also has a white "C" in a pink circle. Compa has long and curly pink/orange hair that is held back with a [[headband]] that also bears a "C." Her eyes are colored pink/orange as well, albeit in a slightly darker shade. Compa has a bust size that is comparable to [[Vert (neptunia)|]]'s and [[Magic the Hard]]'s, as people always tend to comment that she's well-endowed for her age.

Compa is the personification of the game company [[Compile Heart]], the publisher of the [[neptune_(series)|Neptunia]] series.

Voiced by: [[Sakai Kanako]] (Japanese), [[Cristina Valenzuela]] (English)

title: robonep
body: An android copy of [[neptune (neptunia)|Neptune]] that appeared and got mentioned in several spin-off games in the [[neptune_(series)|Neptunia]] series, mostly as a gag to show [[nepgear|Nepgear's]] obsession with her sister and robotics.

title: adult_neptune
body:
A grown up version of the series's main character, [[Neptune (neptunia)|]]. Unlike the original Neptune, this version is a normal human. She first appears offscreen (voice only) in the true ending of [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V|Victory/Re;Birth 3]], with her first proper appearance in [[Shin Jigen Game Neptune VII|Megadimension Neptunia VII]].

[spoiler]This Neptune is from the Ultradimension, but never became a CPU. In the true ending of Victory/Re;Birth 3, she encounters and captures [[Croire]]. She later appears in Megadimension Neptunia VII, having used Croire's dimension travel ability to travel to the Zero Dimension.[/spoiler]

She looks like an [[aged up]] version of Neptune, with [[alternate color|a black]] hoodie and [[long hair|longer]] [[official alternate hair length|hair]]. She [[dual wielding|dual wields]] two [[sword]]s, sometimes replacing one of the swords with a [[handgun]].

Voice actors: [[Tanaka Rie]] (Japanese), [[Melissa Fahn]] (English)

title: histoire
body:
As she is the world's everything and the world is her everything, Histoire can be seen as the goddess of all Gamindustri. Fittingly enough, she has all the world's knowledge and can change it, though not without the power of at least another goddess. Histoire guides [[neptune (neptunia)|Neptune]], [[if (neptunia)|IF]], and [[Compa]] throughout Gamindustri during the events of [[Choujigen Game Neptune]] to help her be released from the seal that was placed on her by the main antagonist [[Magiquone]], enlist the help of the three other goddesses, and save the world from destruction.

In [[Choujigen Game Neptune mk2]], she is the Oracle of Planeptune and watches over the people of that landmass while Neptune, Planeptune's goddess, is still in the Gamindustri Graveyard. By this time, Histoire has apparently saved Planeptune from decline many times, and is seen by the citizens of Planeptune as a great leader.

She and Magiquone were once friends until Gamindustri was split into four.

Voiced by: [[Kanai Mika]] (Japanese), [[Stephanie Sheh]] (English)

title: nepgear
body:
The CPU Candidate of Planeptune and sister to [[neptune (neptunia)|Neptune]]. Despite being 'born' later than Neptune, both her appearance and attitude are more mature (leading to some confusion at times). While she admires her sister and tends to spoil her, she also tries to be strict with her at times (especially when Neptune slacking off, unless she joins her in doing so).

She is friends with the other CPU Candidates [[uni (neptunia)|Uni]] (but Uni is a [[tsundere]] so she wouldn't admit that), [[rom (neptunia)|Rom]] and [[ram (neptunia)|Ram]].

In [[Choujigen Game Neptune MK2]] she had the role of the main character, but by [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V]] she got degraded to a side character and comic relief (which she laments a few times during the course of the story, frequently breaking the 4th wall in doing so). While she frets that she lacks any defining features or traits, she eventually begins to display a talent in electronics and robotics.

Voiced by: [[Horie Yui]] (Japanese), [[Christine Marie Cabanos]] (English)

h4. See also

* [[Purple Sister]], Nepgear's HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form.
* [[purple_sister_(chaos_form)|Purple Sister (Chaos Form)]], it's a corrupted form of Nepgear's HDD form.
* [spoiler][[purple_sister_v|Purple Sister V]], it's a corrupted form of the Nepgear from [[conquest_end|Conquest's End]].[/spoiler]

title: ram_(neptunia)
body:
A CPU Candidate of Lowee. Twin of [[rom (neptunia)|Rom]] and sister to [[Blanc (neptunia)|]]. Very energetic and upbeat, she tends to be hostile to people she doesn't know. Often plays pranks. Similar to [[uni (neptunia)|Uni]], she has some problems expressing her feelings but she overcomes them during the course of [[Choujigen Game Neptune Mk2]].

Friends with the other CPU Candidates.

Voiced by: [[Ishihara Kaori]] (Japanese), Shelby Lindley (English)

h4. See also
* [[White Sister Ram]], Ram's HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form
* [[rom (neptunia)|Rom]], her twin sister.
* [[Blanc (neptunia)|]], her big sister.

title: nippon_ichi_(neptunia)
body:
A character appearing in the [[neptune_(series)|Neptunia franchise]].
Localized in English as [b]Nisa[/b].

A heroine of justice who almost always appears at the scene of the crime in order to defend someone or save others. Though much like Blanc her lacking bustline is a very sore point.

Nippon Ichi is a fair-skinned girl with deep [[blue eyes]] (that turn yellow when angry) and [[blue hair|matching hair]]. Her hair appears to be very [[long hair|long]], but is worn up with a few long, loose curls. She has a pair of black [[goggles on head|goggles worn in her hair]] like a headband. She is very [[flat chest|flat]] with measurements of 74b, 57w, and 80h. She only weighs 44kg and is about 158cm tall. Her cup size is marked as AAA, making her the smallest in the cast. She is often shown with a [[fang|fanged tooth]].

Nippon Ichi wears a revealing [[black bodysuit]] with a zipper down the front, [[partially unzipped]] to below her [[navel]] and bandaging worn around her chest. It has thin red and blue lines on the side and is worn with big cuffed, [[grey gloves]] and [[grey footwear|matching]] [[boots]].  She also wears a long, flowing [[red scarf]], a [[Prinny]]-like backpack, and a grey and gold pouch strapped to her leg. 

She represents the game developer [[Nippon Ichi]], of [[Disgaea]] fame.  Her English name comes from the American branch of the company, "Nippon Ichi Software America".

Due to issues between Idea Factory/Compile Heart and Nippon Ichi, she has not appeared in any of the remakes but has made appearances in recent Disgaea games.

Voiced by: [[Mizuhashi Kaori]] (Japanese), [[Michelle Ruff]] (English)

h4. External links

* "Hyperdimension Neptunia Wiki: Nisa":https://hyperdimensionneptunia.fandom.com/wiki/Nisa

title: albertosaurus
body: Albertosaurus is a genus of large tyrannosaurid theropod dinosaur that lived in northwestern North America during the early to middle Maastrichtian age of the Late Cretaceous period, about 71 million years ago.

title: mages.
body:
Character from the [[Neptune (series)|]] series. She is introduced in [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V|Victory]], also appearing on [[choujigen game neptune|Re;Birth1]] and Re;Birth 3.

A reserved magical girl, she frequently says strange things and tends to repel people. She is based on "MAGES.":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mages_(company)] a video game developer company.

In Re;Birth3, it is revealed that she and [[5pb (neptunia)|]] are cousins (referencing the fact that 5pb. Inc. is the parent company of MAGES. Inc.). Their relation is also the reason MAGES makes various [[Steins;Gate]] references and proclaims to be a "mad magician" (as 5pb. developed the Stein;Gate visual novels).

Voiced by: Furukawa Kaori (Japanese), Amanda Celine Miller (English)

title: 5pb_(neptunia)
body:
Character from the [[Neptune (series)|Neptunia]] series. She is introduced in [[Choujigen Game Neptune|the first game]], and makes further appearances in [[Choujigen Game Neptune mk2| mk2]], Re;Birth2, [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V|Re;Birth3]], and the anime.

She is based on [[5pb.|5pb. Inc.]], a japanese video game manufacturer and record label for video game and anime music. In the Japanese version, she is voiced by nao, who sings the openings to several of the Neptunia games.

In Re;Birth3, it is revealed that she and [[MAGES.]] are cousins (referencing the fact that 5pb. Inc. and MAGES. Inc. are parent companies).

Voiced by: nao (Japanese), Mela Lee (English, the first game), Julie Ann Taylor (English, starting with mk2), Caitlin Glass (English, anime)

In [[Kami Jigen Game Neptune V|Hyperdimension Neptunia Victory]], she wears a costume based on [[Estelle Bright]] from [[Sora no Kiseki]], as both characters share the same [[voice actor]].

title: blanc_(neptunia)
body:
One of four goddesses of Gamindustri, Blanc presides over the Land of White Serenity, Lowee. While she may initially comes off as a shy and quiet girl, Blanc is actually very quick to fly into an outrage and has the mouth of a sailor. She loves [[reading]] [[book]]s, and has once stated that she wants to buy more books, but couldn't because she already has so many and does not want to give up any of the books she already has.

Blanc's usual appearance consists of a large [[white headwear|white]] [[hat|cap]], a short [[white dress]] with brown trim and [[spaghetti strap]]s, and an opened [[white jacket]] with [[fur trim]] which she mainly wears in public. Her eyes are a dark [[blue_eyes|blue]] and her [[short_hair|short]], orderly hair is a sandy [[brown_hair|brown]].  Of the four goddesses her breasts are by far the smallest, ranging from [[small breasts]] to [[flat chest]] depending on the artist. As a result fanart frequently portrays her as having substantial [[breast envy]], especially when appearing alongside Vert.

Blanc represents the [[Nintendo]] [[Wii]], which is somewhat ironic since she has a rather short temper and tends to swear when provoked.

Voiced by: [[Asumi Kana]] (Japanese), [[Wendee Lee]] (English)

h4. See also

* [[White Heart (neptunia)|]], Blanc's HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form
* [[Next White]], Blanc's Next Form

title: noire_(neptunia)
body:
One of four goddesses of Gamindustri, Noire presides over the Land of Black Regality, Lastation. Noire is seen as an ideal goddess, working independently on her own time, though this often gets her sick or wears her out. She is generally very menseful towards everyone, but also comes off as stubborn since she prefers to work alone.

Noire is usually wearing a fancy dress colored dark blue, red, and white with gold buttons and lining here and there. She also sports a blue bow on her back as well as a smaller one around her neck that's attached to a monochrome collar and is adorned with a piece of gold in the center. Noire's hair is tied into two very long pigtails that reach her hips, her bangs being nice and neat, and her eyes are as red as rubies.

The ideal goddess Noire is the personification of the Sony PlayStation 3.

Voiced by: [[Imai Asami]] (Japanese), [[Erin Fitzgerald]] (English, 2011-2016), [[Erica Mendez]] (English, 2017-)

h4. See also

* [[Black Heart (neptunia)|]], Noire's HDD (Hard Drive Divinity) form
* [[Next Black]], Noire's Next Form

title: cat_tower
body:
A cat tower is an artificial structure for a cat to play, exercise, relax and sleep on.

Cat towers vary in height and complexity, with most cats preferring features offering height over comfort, particularly if tall enough to allow a clear survey of their territory. Some cats prefer options which offer shelter or a secluded escape, which may be at any height of the structure.

Conventional cat tower designs are of a floor-based solid structure, composed of square-shaped sheets of particle board (as platforms, boxes and enclosed structures) combined with wooden studs and planks (used as elevators or stairs), with exteriors and interiors typically covered with carpet. Elevators are also frequently covered with abrasive materials (sisal rope being the most common), intended to induce cats to scratch those areas and reduce overall wear of the structure. The levels created by the layer of interactive features offer cats anything from bedding and shelter to exercise and play.
